intro: Paypayrola sprengelii, commonly known as the Sprengel's paypayrola, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Paypayrola sprengelii is considered a rare and endangered species.
